text: amidst emotional scenes the first of
several memorial services have been held
in the American city of Minneapolis to
remember the life of George Floyd the 46
year old black man whose death at the
hands of four white police officers that
sparked several days of protests across
the US and around the world a lawyer for
mr. Floyd's family said his death was
the result of a pandemic of racism and
discrimination it comes as three of the
former Minneapolis police officers
charged with aiding and abetting murder
appeared in court for the first time not
far from where the memorial service was
taking place let's go live now to our
correspondent in Minneapolis Barbara
pleasure father the service ended a
short while ago Clive and I think it
really set the tone for the other
memorials that are to come but also for
the direction in which activists want to
build the momentum take the momentum
that has been building since George
Floyd's death the veterans civil rights
leader Reverend Al Sharpton was speaking
he was very forceful
he said that George Floyd had not died
in vain he said that this was the time
to deal with racism in the criminal
justice system this was the time he said
to take your knee off of our necks
here's my report this is the beginning
of a period of official mourning for
George Floyd but not the end of his
story
[Music]
a pause for breath after 10 traumatic
days the unrest that has shaken the
country in the wake of his death seemed
to demand a collective display of grief
despite the risks of the coronavirus one
by one members of mr. Floyd's family
remembered what he meant to them in life
every day he walks outside it be a line
of people like just like we came in
wanting to greet him and wanted to have
fun with him he was he was powerful man
he had a way with words he could always
make you ready to jump and go all the
time
everybody loves George like he was this
great big giant and when he would when
he would wrap his arms around you you
just feel like you know you were
everything could just go away any
problems you had any concerns your head
would go away but this service was even
more about what George Floyd's death
means to the nation about another black
man in a list of so many killed in
police custody about beginning to shape
the massive movement for racial justice
it ignited I saw somebody standing in
front of a church the other day wood had
been boarded up as a result of violence
held the Bible in his hand I've been
preaching since I was a little boy I
never seen anyone hold a Bible like that
but I'll leave that alone
the civil rights veteran Reverend Al
Sharpton delivered an attack on the
president's recent controversial photo
op but he was blistering about the
violence of structural racism in the
country what happened to Freud happens
every day in this country and education
and health services and in every
area of American life is time for us to
stand up in charge his name and say get
your knee off our necks let us stand
still you that believe in fate by your
heads they were silent for 8 minutes and
46 seconds the time that mr. Floyd spent
with a knee on his neck that numbers
become a potent symbol of police
brutality for protesters in New York
another memorial seeking to build on
momentum for change promising that this
time will be different in Minneapolis
streets bear the scars of the dark days
that followed George Floyd's death
residents hunkered down trying to
protect their livelihoods as protests
turned violent laying waste to hundreds
of businesses but the community has
rallied strongly creating a safe space
to support each other uniting against
the forces that would divide them
determined to lead the country in
pushing for lasting change so it can
finally be the land of the free this has
been a seminal moment for America to
take a look at itself and ask in which
direction it's going
a very moving service Clive but the
immediate focus after these memorials is
justice for mr. Floyd and charges have
been increased against one of the
officers new charges were issued against
the three other officers who were
involved in the arrest they appeared in
court today for the first time with bail
set at a million dollars each the family
called this a step along the road to
justice but they said they were aware
that there could be a long journey
between an arrest and a conviction they
also called it a bittersweet moment and
that is what this day itself has been
for them and for others a bittersweet
moment okay Barbara thank you for that
Barbara pleasure there in Minneapolis
